 1038: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1039: hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config) ->
 1040:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, old).
 1041: 
 1042: hostkey_fingerprint_check_md5(Config) ->
 1043:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, md5).
 1044: 
 1045: hostkey_fingerprint_check_sha(Config) ->
 1046:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, sha).
 1047: 
 1048: hostkey_fingerprint_check_sha256(Config) ->
 1049:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, sha256).
 1050: 
 1051: hostkey_fingerprint_check_sha384(Config) ->
 1052:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, sha384).
 1053: 
 1054: hostkey_fingerprint_check_sha512(Config) ->
 1055:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, sha512).
 1056: 
 1057: hostkey_fingerprint_check_list(Config) ->
 1058:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, [sha,md5,sha256]).
 1059: 
 1060: %%%----
 1061: do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, HashAlg) ->
 1062:     case supported_hash(HashAlg) of
 1063: 	true ->
 1064: 	    really_do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, HashAlg);
 1065: 	false when HashAlg == old ->
 1066: 	    {skip,{unsupported_hash,md5}};% Happen to know that ssh:hostkey_fingerprint/1 uses md5...
 1067: 	false ->
 1068: 	    {skip,{unsupported_hash,HashAlg}}
 1069:     end.
 1070: 
 1071: supported_hash(old) ->
 1072:     supported_hash(md5); % Happen to know that ssh:hostkey_fingerprint/1 uses md5...
 1073: supported_hash(HashAlg) ->
 1074:     Hs = if is_atom(HashAlg) -> [HashAlg];
 1075:             is_list(HashAlg) -> HashAlg
 1076:          end,
 1077:     [] == (Hs -- proplists:get_value(hashs, crypto:supports(), [])).
 1078: 
 1079: 
 1080: really_do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, HashAlg) ->
 1081:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1082:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1083: 
 1084:     %% All host key fingerprints.  Trust that public_key has checked the hostkey_fingerprint
 1085:     %% function since that function is used by the ssh client...
 1086:     FPs0 = [case HashAlg of
 1087: 	       old -> ssh:hostkey_fingerprint(Key);
 1088: 	       _ -> ssh:hostkey_fingerprint(HashAlg, Key)
 1089: 	   end
 1090: 	   || FileCandidate <- begin
 1091: 				   {ok,KeyFileCands} = file:list_dir(SysDir),
 1092: 				   KeyFileCands
 1093: 			       end,
 1094: 	      nomatch =/= re:run(FileCandidate, ".*\\.pub", []),
 1095: 	      {Key,_Cmnts} <- begin
 1096: 				  {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(filename:join(SysDir, FileCandidate)),
 1097: 				  try ssh_file:decode(Bin, public_key)
 1098: 				  catch
 1099: 				      _:_ -> []
 1100: 				  end
 1101: 			      end],
 1102:     FPs = if is_atom(HashAlg) -> FPs0;
 1103:              is_list(HashAlg) -> lists:concat(FPs0)
 1104:           end,
 1105:     ct:log("Fingerprints(~p) = ~p",[HashAlg,FPs]),
 1106: 
 1107:     %% Start daemon with the public keys that we got fingerprints from
 1108:     {Pid, Host0, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1109: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1110: 					     {password, "morot"}]),
 1111:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(Host0),
 1112:     FP_check_fun = fun(PeerName, FP) ->
 1113: 			   ct:log("PeerName = ~p, FP = ~p",[PeerName,FP]),
 1114: 			   HostCheck = ssh_test_lib:match_ip(Host, PeerName),
 1115: 			   FPCheck = 
 1116:                                if is_atom(HashAlg) -> lists:member(FP, FPs);
 1117:                                   is_list(HashAlg) -> lists:all(fun(FP1) -> lists:member(FP1,FPs) end,
 1118:                                                                 FP)
 1119:                                end,
 1120: 			   ct:log("check ~p == ~p (~p) and ~n~p~n in ~p (~p)~n",
 1121: 				  [PeerName,Host,HostCheck,FP,FPs,FPCheck]),
 1122: 			   HostCheck and FPCheck
 1123: 		   end,
 1124:     
 1125:     ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts,
 1126: 				       case HashAlg of
 1127: 					   old -> FP_check_fun;
 1128: 					   _ -> {HashAlg, FP_check_fun}
 1129: 				       end},
 1130: 				      {user, "foo"},
 1131: 				      {password, "morot"},
 1132: 				      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1133:                                       {save_accepted_host, false}, % Ensure no 'known_hosts' disturbs
 1134: 				      {user_interaction, false}]),
 1135:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1136: 
 1137: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1138: %%% Test connect_timeout option in ssh:connect/4
 1139: ssh_connect_timeout(_Config) ->
 1140:     ConnTimeout = 2000,
 1141:     {error,{faked_transport,connect,TimeoutToTransport}} = 
 1142: 	ssh:connect("localhost", 12345, 
 1143: 		    [{transport,{tcp,?MODULE,tcp_closed}},
 1144:                      {save_accepted_host, false},
 1145: 		     {connect_timeout,ConnTimeout}],
 1146: 		    1000),
 1147:     case TimeoutToTransport of
 1148: 	ConnTimeout -> ok;
 1149: 	Other -> 
 1150: 	    ct:log("connect_timeout is ~p but transport received ~p",[ConnTimeout,Other]),
 1151: 	    {fail,"ssh:connect/4 wrong connect_timeout received in transport"}
 1152:     end.
 1153:     
 1154: %% Plugin function for the test above
 1155: connect(_Host, _Port, _Opts, Timeout) ->
 1156:     {error, {faked_transport,connect,Timeout}}.
 1157: 
 1158: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1159: %%% Test fourth argument in ssh:connect/4
 1160: ssh_connect_arg4_timeout(_Config) ->
 1161:     Timeout = 1000,
 1162:     Parent = self(),
 1163:     %% start the server
 1164:     Server = spawn(fun() ->
 1165: 			   {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0,[]),
 1166: 			   {ok,{_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
 1167: 			   Parent ! {port,self(),Port},
 1168: 			   Rsa = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1169: 			   ct:log("Server gen_tcp:accept got ~p",[Rsa]),
 1170: 			   receive after 2*Timeout -> ok end %% let client timeout first
 1171: 		   end),
 1172: 
 1173:     %% Get listening port
 1174:     Port = receive
 1175: 	       {port,Server,ServerPort} -> ServerPort
 1176: 	   after 
 1177: 	       10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1178: 	   end,
 1179: 
 1180:     %% try to connect with a timeout, but "supervise" it
 1181:     Client = spawn(fun() ->
 1182: 			   T0 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 1183: 			   Rc = ssh:connect("localhost",Port,[{save_accepted_host, false}],Timeout),
 1184: 			   ct:log("Client ssh:connect got ~p",[Rc]),
 1185: 			   Parent ! {done,self(),Rc,T0}
 1186: 		   end),
 1187: 
 1188:     %% Wait for client reaction on the connection try:
 1189:     receive
 1190: 	{done, Client, {error,timeout}, T0} ->
 1191: 	    Msp = ms_passed(T0),
 1192: 	    exit(Server,hasta_la_vista___baby),
 1193: 	    Low = 0.9*Timeout,
 1194: 	    High =  4.0*Timeout,
 1195: 	    ct:log("Timeout limits: ~.4f - ~.4f ms, timeout "
 1196:                    "was ~.4f ms, expected ~p ms",[Low,High,Msp,Timeout]),
 1197: 	    if
 1198: 		Low<Msp, Msp<High -> ok;
 1199: 		true -> {fail, "timeout not within limits"}
 1200: 	    end;
 1201: 
 1202: 	{done, Client, {error,Other}, _T0} ->
 1203: 	    ct:log("Error message \"~p\" from the client is unexpected.",[{error,Other}]),
 1204: 	    {fail, "Unexpected error message"};
 1205: 
 1206: 	{done, Client, {ok,_Ref}, _T0} ->
 1207: 	    {fail,"ssh-connected ???"}
 1208:     after
 1209: 	5000 ->
 1210: 	    exit(Server,hasta_la_vista___baby),
 1211: 	    exit(Client,hasta_la_vista___baby),
 1212: 	    {fail, "Didn't timeout"}
 1213:     end.
 1214: 
 1215: %% Help function, elapsed milliseconds since T0
 1216: ms_passed(T0) ->
 1217:     %% OTP 18
 1218:     erlang:convert_time_unit(erlang:monotonic_time() - T0,
 1219: 			     native,
 1220: 			     micro_seconds) / 1000.
 1221: 
 1222: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1223: ssh_daemon_minimal_remote_max_packet_size_option(Config) ->
 1224:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1225:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config), 
 1226:     
 1227:     {Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},
 1228: 						{user_dir, UserDir},
 1229: 						{user_passwords, [{"vego", "morot"}]},
 1230: 						{failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2},
 1231: 						{minimal_remote_max_packet_size, 14}]),
 1232:     Conn =
 1233: 	ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1234: 					  {user_dir, UserDir},
 1235: 					  {user_interaction, false},
 1236: 					  {user, "vego"},
 1237: 					  {password, "morot"}]),
 1238: 
 1239:     %% Try the limits of the minimal_remote_max_packet_size:
 1240:     {ok, _ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(Conn, 100, 14, infinity),
 1241:     {open_error,_,"Maximum packet size below 14 not supported",_} = 
 1242: 	ssh_connection:session_channel(Conn, 100, 13, infinity),
 1243: 
 1244:     ssh:close(Conn),
 1245:     ssh:stop_daemon(Server).
 1246:     
 1247: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1248: %% This test try every algorithm by connecting to an Erlang server
 1249: id_string_no_opt_client(Config) ->
 1250:     {Server, _Host, Port} = fake_daemon(Config),
 1251:     {error,_} = ssh:connect("localhost", Port, [{save_accepted_host, false}], 1000),
 1252:     receive
 1253: 	{id,Server,"SSH-2.0-Erlang/"++Vsn} ->
 1254: 	    true = expected_ssh_vsn(Vsn);
 1255: 	{id,Server,Other} ->
 1256: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Other])
 1257:     after 5000 ->
 1258: 	    {fail,timeout}
 1259:     end.
 1260: 
 1261: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1262: id_string_own_string_client(Config) ->
 1263:     {Server, _Host, Port} = fake_daemon(Config),
 1264:     {error,_} = ssh:connect("localhost", Port, [{id_string,"Pelle"},
 1265:                                                 {save_accepted_host, false}
 1266:                                                ], 1000),
 1267:     receive
 1268: 	{id,Server,"SSH-2.0-Pelle\r\n"} ->
 1269: 	    ok;
 1270: 	{id,Server,Other} ->
 1271: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Other])
 1272:     after 5000 ->
 1273: 	    {fail,timeout}
 1274:     end.
 1275: 
 1276: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1277: id_string_own_string_client_trail_space(Config) ->
 1278:     {Server, _Host, Port} = fake_daemon(Config),
 1279:     {error,_} = ssh:connect("localhost", Port, [{id_string,"Pelle "},
 1280:                                                 {save_accepted_host, false}], 1000),
 1281:     receive
 1282: 	{id,Server,"SSH-2.0-Pelle \r\n"} ->
 1283: 	    ok;
 1284: 	{id,Server,Other} ->
 1285: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Other])
 1286:     after 5000 ->
 1287: 	    {fail,timeout}
 1288:     end.
 1289: 
 1290: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1291: id_string_random_client(Config) ->
 1292:     {Server, _Host, Port} = fake_daemon(Config),
 1293:     {error,_} = ssh:connect("localhost", Port, [{id_string,random},
 1294:                                                 {save_accepted_host, false}], 1000),
 1295:     receive
 1296: 	{id,Server,Id="SSH-2.0-Erlang"++_} ->
 1297: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Id]);
 1298: 	{id,Server,Rnd="SSH-2.0-"++ID} when 4=<length(ID),length(ID)=<7 -> %% Add 2 for CRLF
 1299: 	    ct:log("Got correct ~s",[Rnd]);
 1300: 	{id,Server,Id} ->
 1301: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Id])
 1302:     after 5000 ->
 1303: 	    {fail,timeout}
 1304:     end.
 1305: 
 1306: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1307: id_string_no_opt_server(Config) ->
 1308:     {_Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config, []),
 1309:     {ok,S1}=ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host,Port,[{active,false},{packet,line}]),
 1310:     {ok,"SSH-2.0-Erlang/"++Vsn} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, 0, 2000),
 1311:     true = expected_ssh_vsn(Vsn).
 1312: 
 1313: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1314: id_string_own_string_server(Config) ->
 1315:     {_Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config, [{id_string,"Olle"}]),
 1316:     {ok,S1}=ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host,Port,[{active,false},{packet,line}]),
 1317:     {ok,"SSH-2.0-Olle\r\n"} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, 0, 2000).
 1318: 
 1319: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1320: id_string_own_string_server_trail_space(Config) ->
 1321:     {_Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config, [{id_string,"Olle "}]),
 1322:     {ok,S1}=ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host,Port,[{active,false},{packet,line}]),
 1323:     {ok,"SSH-2.0-Olle \r\n"} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, 0, 2000).
 1324: 
 1325: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1326: id_string_random_server(Config) ->
 1327:     %% Check undocumented format of id_string. First a bad variant:
 1328:     {error,{eoptions,_}} = ssh:daemon(0, [{id_string,{random,8,6}}]),
 1329:     %% And then a correct one:
 1330:     {_Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config, [{id_string,{random,6,8}}]),
 1331:     {ok,S1}=ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host,Port,[{active,false},{packet,line}]),
 1332:     {ok,"SSH-2.0-"++Rnd} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, 0, 2000),
 1333:     case Rnd of
 1334: 	"Erlang"++_ -> ct:log("Id=~p",[Rnd]),
 1335: 		       {fail,got_default_id};
 1336: 	"Olle\r\n" -> {fail,got_previous_tests_value};
 1337: 	_ when 8=<length(Rnd),length(Rnd)=<10 -> %% Add 2 for CRLF
 1338: 	    ct:log("Got correct ~s",[Rnd]);
 1339: 	_ ->
 1340:             ct:log("Got wrong sized ~s.",[Rnd]),
 1341:             {fail,got_wrong_size}
 1342:     end.
 1343: 
 1344: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1345: ssh_connect_negtimeout_parallel(Config) -> ssh_connect_negtimeout(Config,true).
 1346: ssh_connect_negtimeout_sequential(Config) -> ssh_connect_negtimeout(Config,false).
 1347:     
 1348: ssh_connect_negtimeout(Config, Parallel) ->
 1349:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1350:     SystemDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system),
 1351:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1352:     NegTimeOut = 2000,				% ms
 1353:     ct:log("Parallel: ~p",[Parallel]),
 1354: 
 1355:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},{user_dir, UserDir},
 1356:                                                {parallel_login, Parallel},
 1357:                                                {negotiation_timeout, NegTimeOut},
 1358:                                                {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
 1359: 
 1360:     {ok,Socket} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1361: 
 1362:     Factor = 2,
 1363:     ct:log("And now sleeping ~p*NegTimeOut (~p ms)...", [Factor, round(Factor * NegTimeOut)]),
 1364:     ct:sleep(round(Factor * NegTimeOut)),
 1365:     
 1366:     case inet:sockname(Socket) of
 1367: 	{ok,_} -> 
 1368: 	    %% Give it another chance...
 1369: 	    ct:log("Sleep more...",[]),
 1370: 	    ct:sleep(round(Factor * NegTimeOut)),
 1371: 	    case inet:sockname(Socket) of
 1372: 		{ok,_} -> ct:fail("Socket not closed");
 1373: 		{error,_} -> ok
 1374: 	    end;
 1375: 	{error,_} -> ok
 1376:     end.
 1377: 
 1378: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1379: %%% Test that ssh connection does not timeout if the connection is established (parallel)
 1380: ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected_parallel(Config) ->
 1381:     ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected(Config, true).
 1382: 
 1383: %%% Test that ssh connection does not timeout if the connection is established (non-parallel)
 1384: ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected_sequential(Config) ->
 1385:     ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected(Config, false).
 1386: 
 1387: 
 1388: ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected(Config, Parallel) ->
 1389:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1390:     SystemDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system),
 1391:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1392:     NegTimeOut = 2000,				% ms
 1393:     ct:log("Parallel: ~p",[Parallel]),
 1394:    
 1395:     {_Pid, _Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},{user_dir, UserDir},
 1396: 					       {parallel_login, Parallel},
 1397: 					       {negotiation_timeout, NegTimeOut},
 1398: 					       {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
 1399:     ct:log("~p Listen ~p:~p",[_Pid,_Host,Port]),
 1400:     ct:sleep(500),
 1401: 
 1402:     IO = ssh_test_lib:start_io_server(),
 1403:     Shell = ssh_test_lib:start_shell(Port, IO, [{user_dir,UserDir}]),
 1404:     receive
 1405: 	Error = {'EXIT', _, _} ->
 1406: 	    ct:log("~p",[Error]),
 1407: 	    ct:fail(no_ssh_connection);  
 1408: 	ErlShellStart ->
 1409: 	    ct:log("---Erlang shell start: ~p~n", [ErlShellStart]),
 1410: 	    one_shell_op(IO, NegTimeOut),
 1411: 	    one_shell_op(IO, NegTimeOut),
 1412: 
 1413: 	    Factor = 2,
 1414: 	    ct:log("And now sleeping ~p*NegTimeOut (~p ms)...", [Factor, round(Factor * NegTimeOut)]),
 1415: 	    ct:sleep(round(Factor * NegTimeOut)),
 1416:     
 1417: 	    one_shell_op(IO, NegTimeOut)
 1418:     after 
 1419: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1420:     end,
 1421:     exit(Shell, kill).
 1422: 
 1423: 
 1424: one_shell_op(IO, TimeOut) ->
 1425:     ct:log("One shell op: Waiting for prompter"),
 1426:     receive
 1427: 	ErlPrompt0 -> ct:log("Erlang prompt: ~p~n", [ErlPrompt0])
 1428:     after TimeOut -> ct:fail("Timeout waiting for promter")
 1429:     end,
 1430: 
 1431:     IO ! {input, self(), "2*3*7.\r\n"},
 1432:     receive
 1433: 	Result0 -> ct:log("Result: ~p~n", [Result0])
 1434:     after TimeOut ->  ct:fail("Timeout waiting for result")
 1435:     end.
 1436: 
 1437: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1438: max_log_item_len(Config) ->
 1439:     %% Find a supported algorithm (to be removed from the daemon):
 1440:     {ok, {Type,Alg}} = select_alg( ssh:default_algorithms() ),
 1441: 
 1442:     %% Start a test daemon without support for {Type,Alg}
 1443:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1444:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1445:     {_Pid, Host0, Port} =
 1446:         ssh_test_lib:daemon([
 1447:                              {system_dir, SystemDir},
 1448:                              {user_dir, UserDir},
 1449:                              {user_passwords, [{"carni", "meat"}]},
 1450:                              {modify_algorithms, [{rm, [{Type,[Alg]}]}]},
 1451:                              {max_log_item_len, 10}
 1452:                             ]),
 1453:     Host = ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(Host0),
 1454:     ct:log("~p:~p Listen ~p:~p. Mangled Host = ~p",
 1455:            [?MODULE,?LINE,Host0,Port,Host]),
 1456: 
 1457:     {ok,ReportHandlerPid} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:add_report_handler(),
 1458: 
 1459:     %% Connect to it with the {Type,Alg} to force a failure and log entry:
 1460:     {error,_} = R =
 1461:         ssh:connect(Host, Port, 
 1462:                     [{preferred_algorithms, [{Type,[Alg]}]},
 1463:                      {max_log_item_len, 10},
 1464:                      {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1465:                      {save_accepted_host, false},
 1466:                      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1467:                      {user_interaction, false},
 1468:                      {user, "carni"},
 1469:                      {password, "meat"}
 1470:                     ]),
 1471: 
 1472:     {ok, Reports} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:get_reports(ReportHandlerPid),
 1473:     ct:log("~p:~p ssh:connect -> ~p~n~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,R,Reports]),
 1474: 
 1475:     [ok] =
 1476:         lists:usort(
 1477:           [check_skip_part(
 1478:              string:tokens(
 1479:                lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,Args)),
 1480:                " \n"))
 1481:            || {info_msg,_,{_,Fmt,Args}} <- Reports]
 1482:           ).
 1483: 
 1484: 
 1485: check_skip_part(["Disconnect","...","("++_NumSkipped, "bytes","skipped)"]) ->
 1486:     ok;
 1487: check_skip_part([_|T]) ->
 1488:     check_skip_part(T);
 1489: check_skip_part([]) ->
 1490:     error.
 1491: 
 1492: select_alg([{Type,[A,_|_]}|_]) when is_atom(A) -> {ok, {Type,A}};
 1493: select_alg([{Type,[{Dir,[A,_|_]}, _]}|_]) when is_atom(A), is_atom(Dir) -> {ok, {Type,A}};
 1494: select_alg([{Type,[_,{Dir,[A,_|_]}]}|_]) when is_atom(A), is_atom(Dir) -> {ok, {Type,A}};
 1495: select_alg([_|Algs]) -> select_alg(Algs);
 1496: select_alg([]) -> false.
 1497: 
 1498: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1499: max_sessions_ssh_connect_parallel(Config) -> 
 1500:     max_sessions(Config, true, connect_fun(ssh__connect,Config)).
 1501: max_sessions_ssh_connect_sequential(Config) -> 
 1502:     max_sessions(Config, false, connect_fun(ssh__connect,Config)).
 1503: 
 1504: max_sessions_sftp_start_channel_parallel(Config) -> 
 1505:     max_sessions(Config, true, connect_fun(ssh_sftp__start_channel, Config)).
 1506: max_sessions_sftp_start_channel_sequential(Config) -> 
 1507:     max_sessions(Config, false, connect_fun(ssh_sftp__start_channel, Config)).
 1508: 
 1509: 
 1510: %%%---- helpers:
 1511: connect_fun(ssh__connect, Config) ->
 1512:     fun(Host,Port) ->
 1513: 	    ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, 
 1514: 				 [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1515: 				  {user_dir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config)},
 1516: 				  {user_interaction, false},
 1517: 				  {user, "carni"},
 1518: 				  {password, "meat"}
 1519: 				 ])
 1520: 	    %% ssh_test_lib returns R when ssh:connect returns {ok,R}
 1521:     end;
 1522: connect_fun(ssh_sftp__start_channel, _Config) ->
 1523:     fun(Host,Port) ->
 1524: 	    {ok,_Pid,ConnRef} =
 1525: 		ssh_sftp:start_channel(Host, Port, 
 1526: 				       [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1527:                                         {save_accepted_host, false},
 1528: 					{user, "carni"},
 1529: 					{password, "meat"}
 1530: 				       ]),
 1531: 	    ConnRef
 1532:     end.
 1533: 
 1534: 
 1535: max_sessions(Config, ParallelLogin, Connect0) when is_function(Connect0,2) ->
 1536:     Connect = fun(Host,Port) ->
 1537: 		      R = Connect0(Host,Port),
 1538: 		      ct:log("Connect(~p,~p) -> ~p",[Host,Port,R]),
 1539: 		      R
 1540: 	      end,
 1541:     SystemDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system),
 1542:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1543:     MaxSessions = 5,
 1544:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([
 1545: 					     {system_dir, SystemDir},
 1546: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1547: 					     {user_passwords, [{"carni", "meat"}]},
 1548: 					     {parallel_login, ParallelLogin},
 1549: 					     {max_sessions, MaxSessions}
 1550: 					    ]),
 1551:     ct:log("~p Listen ~p:~p for max ~p sessions",[Pid,Host,Port,MaxSessions]),
 1552:     try [Connect(Host,Port) || _ <- lists:seq(1,MaxSessions)]
 1553:     of
 1554: 	Connections ->
 1555: 	    %% Step 1 ok: could set up max_sessions connections
 1556: 	    ct:log("Connections up: ~p",[Connections]),
 1557: 	    [_|_] = Connections,
 1558: 
 1559: 	    %% N w try one more than allowed:
 1560: 	    ct:log("Info Report expected here (if not disabled) ...",[]),
 1561: 	    try Connect(Host,Port)
 1562: 	    of
 1563: 		_ConnectionRef1 ->
 1564: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1565: 		    {fail,"Too many connections accepted"}
 1566: 	    catch
 1567: 		error:{badmatch,{error,"Connection closed"}} ->
 1568:                     ct:log("Step 2 ok: could not set up too many connections. Good.",[]),
 1569: 		    %% Now stop one connection and try to open one more
 1570: 		    ok = ssh:close(hd(Connections)),
 1571: 		    try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid)
 1572: 	    end
 1573:     catch
 1574: 	error:{badmatch,{error,"Connection closed"}} ->
 1575: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1576: 	    {fail,"Too few connections accepted"}
 1577:     end.
 1578: 
 1579: 
 1580: try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid) ->
 1581:     {ok,Tref} = timer:send_after(30000, timeout_no_connection), % give the supervisors some time...
 1582:     try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid, Tref, 1). % will take max 3300 ms after 11 tries
 1583: 
 1584: try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid, Tref, N) ->
 1585:      try Connect(Host,Port)
 1586:      of
 1587: 	 _ConnectionRef1 ->
 1588: 	     timer:cancel(Tref),
 1589:              ct:log("Step 3 ok: could set up one more connection after killing one. That's good.",[]),
 1590: 	     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1591: 	     receive % flush. 
 1592: 		 timeout_no_connection -> ok
 1593: 	     after 0 -> ok
 1594: 	     end
 1595:      catch
 1596: 	 error:{badmatch,{error,"Connection closed"}} ->
 1597: 	     %% Could not set up one more connection. Try again until timeout.
 1598: 	     receive
 1599: 		 timeout_no_connection ->
 1600: 		     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1601: 		     {fail,"Does not decrease # active sessions"}
 1602: 	     after N*50 -> % retry after this time
 1603: 		     try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid, Tref, N+1)
 1604: 	     end
 1605:      end.
 1606: 
 1607: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1608: max_sessions_drops_tcp_connects() ->
 1609:     [{timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
 1610: 
 1611: max_sessions_drops_tcp_connects(Config) ->
 1612:     MaxSessions = 20,
 1613:     UseSessions = 2, % Must be =< MaxSessions
 1614:     FloodSessions = 1000,
 1615:     ParallelLogin = true,
 1616:     NegTimeOut = 8*1000,
 1617:     HelloTimeOut = 200,
 1618: 
 1619:     %% Start a test daemon
 1620:     SystemDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system),
 1621:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1622:     {Pid, Host0, Port} =
 1623:         ssh_test_lib:daemon([
 1624:                              {system_dir, SystemDir},
 1625:                              {user_dir, UserDir},
 1626:                              {user_passwords, [{"carni", "meat"}]},
 1627:                              {parallel_login, ParallelLogin},
 1628:                              {hello_timeout, HelloTimeOut},
 1629:                              {negotiation_timeout, NegTimeOut},
 1630:                              {max_sessions, MaxSessions}
 1631:                             ]),
 1632:     Host = ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(Host0),
 1633:     ct:log("~p:~p ~p Listen ~p:~p for max ~p sessions. Mangled Host = ~p",
 1634:            [?MODULE,?LINE,Pid,Host0,Port,MaxSessions,Host]),
 1635:     
 1636:     %% Log in UseSessions connections
 1637:     SSHconnect = fun(N) ->
 1638:                          R = ssh:connect(Host, Port, 
 1639:                                          [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1640:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1641:                                           {user_dir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config)},
 1642:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1643:                                           {user, "carni"},
 1644:                                           {password, "meat"}
 1645:                                          ]),
 1646:                          ct:log("~p:~p ~p: ssh:connect -> ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,N,R]),
 1647:                          R
 1648:                  end,
 1649: 
 1650:     L1 = oks([SSHconnect(N) || N <- lists:seq(1,UseSessions)]),
 1651:     case length(L1) of
 1652:         UseSessions ->
 1653:             %% As expected
 1654:             %% Try gen_tcp:connect
 1655:             [ct:log("~p:~p ~p: gen_tcp:connect -> ~p", 
 1656:                     [?MODULE,?LINE, N, gen_tcp:connect(Host, Port, [])])
 1657:              || N <- lists:seq(UseSessions+1, MaxSessions)
 1658:             ],
 1659: 
 1660:             ct:log("~p:~p Now try ~p gen_tcp:connect to be rejected", [?MODULE,?LINE,FloodSessions]),
 1661:             [ct:log("~p:~p ~p: gen_tcp:connect -> ~p", 
 1662:                     [?MODULE,?LINE, N, gen_tcp:connect(Host, Port, [])])
 1663:              || N <- lists:seq(MaxSessions+1, MaxSessions+1+FloodSessions)
 1664:             ],
 1665:             
 1666:             ct:log("~p:~p try ~p ssh:connect", [?MODULE,?LINE, MaxSessions - UseSessions]),
 1667:             try_ssh_connect(MaxSessions - UseSessions, NegTimeOut, SSHconnect);
 1668: 
 1669:         Len1 ->
 1670:             {fail, Len1}
 1671:     end.
 1672: 
 1673: try_ssh_connect(N, NegTimeOut, F) when N>0 ->
 1674:     case F(N) of
 1675:         {ok,_} ->
 1676:             try_ssh_connect(N-1, NegTimeOut, F);
 1677:         {error,_} when N==1 ->
 1678:             try_ssh_connect(N, NegTimeOut, F);
 1679:         {error,_} ->
 1680:             timer:sleep(NegTimeOut),
 1681:             try_ssh_connect(N, NegTimeOut, F)
 1682:     end;
 1683: try_ssh_connect(_N, _NegTimeOut, _F) ->
 1684:     done.
 1685: 
 1686: 
 1687: oks(L) -> lists:filter(fun({ok,_}) -> true;
 1688:                           (_) -> false
 1689:                        end, L).
 1690:     
 1691: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1692: save_accepted_host_option(Config) ->
 1693:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1694:     KnownHosts = filename:join(UserDir, "known_hosts"),
 1695:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),	  
 1696:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1697: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1698: 					     {user_passwords, [{"vego", "morot"}]}
 1699:                                             ]),
 1700:     {error,enoent} = file:read_file(KnownHosts),
 1701: 
 1702:     {ok,_C1} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1703:                                         {save_accepted_host, false},
 1704:                                         {user, "vego"},
 1705:                                         {password, "morot"},
 1706:                                         {user_interaction, false},
 1707:                                         {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1708:     {error,enoent} = file:read_file(KnownHosts),
 1709:     
 1710:     {ok,_C2} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1711:                                         {user, "vego"},
 1712:                                         {password, "morot"},
 1713:                                         {user_interaction, false},
 1714:                                         {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1715:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(KnownHosts),
 1716:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1717: 
 1718: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1719: raw_option(_Config) ->
 1720:     Opts = [{raw,1,2,3,4}],
 1721:     #{socket_options := Opts} = ssh_options:handle_options(client, Opts),
 1722:     #{socket_options := Opts} = ssh_options:handle_options(server, Opts).
 1723: 
 1724: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1725: config_file(Config) ->
 1726:     %% First find common algs:
 1727:     ServerAlgs = ssh_test_lib:default_algorithms(sshd),
 1728:     OurAlgs = ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(), % Incl disabled but supported
 1729:     CommonAlgs = ssh_test_lib:intersection(ServerAlgs, OurAlgs),
 1730:     ct:log("ServerAlgs =~n~p~n~nOurAlgs =~n~p~n~nCommonAlgs =~n~p",[ServerAlgs,OurAlgs,CommonAlgs]),   
 1731:     Nkex = length(proplists:get_value(kex, CommonAlgs, [])),
 1732: 
 1733:     %% Adjust for very old ssh daemons that only supports ssh-rsa and ssh-dss:
 1734:     AdjustClient =
 1735:         case proplists:get_value(public_key,ServerAlgs,[]) -- ['ssh-rsa','ssh-dss'] of
 1736:             [] ->
 1737:                 %% Old, let the client support them also:
 1738:                 ct:log("Adjust the client's public_key set", []),
 1739:                 [{public_key, ['ssh-rsa','ssh-dss']}];
 1740:             [_|_] ->
 1741:                 %% Ok, let the client be un-modified:
 1742:                 []
 1743:         end,
 1744: 
 1745:     case {ServerAlgs, ssh_test_lib:some_empty(CommonAlgs)} of
 1746:         {[],_} ->
 1747:             {skip, "No server algorithms found"};
 1748:         {_,true} ->
 1749:             {fail, "Missing common algorithms"};
 1750:         _ when Nkex<3 ->
 1751:             {skip, "Not enough number of common kex"};
 1752:         _ ->
 1753:             %% Then find three common kex and one common cipher:
 1754:             [K1a,K1b,K2a|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, CommonAlgs),
 1755:             [{_,[Ch1|_]}|_] = proplists:get_value(cipher, CommonAlgs),
 1756: 
 1757:             %% Make config file:
 1758:             {ok,ConfFile} = 
 1759:                 make_config_file_in_privdir(
 1760:                   "c2.config", Config,
 1761:                   [{ssh, [{preferred_algorithms,
 1762:                            [{cipher, [Ch1]},
 1763:                             {kex,    [K1a]}
 1764:                            ] ++ AdjustClient},
 1765:                           {client_options,
 1766:                            [{modify_algorithms,
 1767:                              [{rm,     [{kex, [K1a]}]},
 1768:                               {append, [{kex, [K1b]}]}
 1769:                              ]}
 1770:                            ]}
 1771:                          ]}
 1772:                   ]),
 1773: 
 1774:             %% Start the slave node with the configuration just made:
 1775:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-config", ConfFile]),
 1776: 
 1777:             R0 = rpc:call(Node, ssh, default_algorithms, []),
 1778:             ct:log("R0 = ~p",[R0]),
 1779:             R0 = ssh:default_algorithms(),
 1780: 
 1781:             %% Start ssh on the slave. This should apply the ConfFile:
 1782:             rpc:call(Node, ssh, start, []),
 1783: 
 1784:             R1 = rpc:call(Node, ssh, default_algorithms, []),
 1785:             ct:log("R1 = ~p",[R1]),
 1786:             [{kex,[K1a]},
 1787:              {public_key,_},
 1788:              {cipher,[{_,[Ch1]},
 1789:                       {_,[Ch1]}]} | _] = R1,
 1790: 
 1791:             %% First connection. The client_options should be applied:
 1792:             {ok,C1} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connect, [loopback, ?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT,
 1793:                                                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1794:                                                      {save_accepted_host, false},
 1795:                                                      {user_interaction, false}
 1796:                                                     ]]),
 1797:             ct:log("C1 = ~n~p", [C1]),
 1798:             {algorithms,As1} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C1, algorithms]),
 1799:             K1b = proplists:get_value(kex, As1),
 1800:             Ch1 = proplists:get_value(encrypt, As1),
 1801:             Ch1 = proplists:get_value(decrypt, As1),
 1802:             {options,Os1} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C1, options]),
 1803:             ct:log("C1 algorithms:~n~p~n~noptions:~n~p", [As1,Os1]),
 1804: 
 1805:             %% Second connection, the Options take precedence:
 1806:             C2_Opts = [{modify_algorithms,[{rm,[{kex,[K1b]}]}, % N.B.
 1807:                                            {append, [{kex,[K2a]}]}]},
 1808:                        {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1809:                        {save_accepted_host, false},
 1810:                        {user_interaction, false}
 1811:                       ],
 1812:             {ok,C2} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connect, [loopback, ?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, C2_Opts]),
 1813:             {algorithms,As2} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C2, algorithms]),
 1814:             K2a = proplists:get_value(kex, As2),
 1815:             Ch1 = proplists:get_value(encrypt, As2),
 1816:             Ch1 = proplists:get_value(decrypt, As2),
 1817:             {options,Os2} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C2, options]),
 1818:             ct:log("C2 opts:~n~p~n~nalgorithms:~n~p~n~noptions:~n~p", [C2_Opts,As2,Os2]),
 1819: 
 1820:             peer:stop(Peer)
 1821:     end.
 1822:     
 1823: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1824: config_file_modify_algorithms_order(Config) ->
 1825:     %% First find common algs:
 1826:     ServerAlgs = ssh_test_lib:default_algorithms(sshd),
 1827:     OurAlgs = ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(), % Incl disabled but supported
 1828:     CommonAlgs = ssh_test_lib:intersection(ServerAlgs, OurAlgs),
 1829:     ct:log("ServerAlgs =~n~p~n~nOurAlgs =~n~p~n~nCommonAlgs =~n~p",[ServerAlgs,OurAlgs,CommonAlgs]),
 1830:     Nkex = length(proplists:get_value(kex, CommonAlgs, [])),
 1831:     case {ServerAlgs, ssh_test_lib:some_empty(CommonAlgs)} of
 1832:         {[],_} ->
 1833:             {skip, "No server algorithms found"};
 1834:         {_,true} ->
 1835:             {fail, "Missing common algorithms"};
 1836:         _ when Nkex<3 ->
 1837:             {skip, "Not enough number of common kex"};
 1838:         _ ->
 1839:             %% Then find three common kex and one common cipher:
 1840:             [K1,K2,K3|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, CommonAlgs),
 1841:             [{_,[Ch1|_]}|_] = proplists:get_value(cipher, CommonAlgs),
 1842: 
 1843:             %% Make config file:
 1844:             {ok, ConfFile} =
 1845:                 make_config_file_in_privdir(
 1846:                   "c3.config", Config,
 1847:                   [{ssh, [{preferred_algorithms,
 1848:                            [{cipher, [Ch1]},
 1849:                             {kex,    [K1]}
 1850:                            ]},
 1851:                           {server_options,
 1852:                            [{modify_algorithms,
 1853:                              [{rm,     [{kex, [K1]}]},
 1854:                               {append, [{kex, [K2]}]}
 1855:                              ]}
 1856:                            ]},
 1857:                           {client_options,
 1858:                            [{modify_algorithms,
 1859:                              [{rm,     [{kex, [K1]}]},
 1860:                               {append, [{kex, [K3]}]}
 1861:                              ]}
 1862:                            ]}
 1863:                          ]}
 1864:                   ]),
 1865: 
 1866:             %% Start the slave node with the configuration just made:
 1867:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-config", ConfFile]),
 1868:     
 1869:             R0 = rpc:call(Node, ssh, default_algorithms, []),
 1870:             ct:log("R0 = ~p",[R0]),
 1871:             R0 = ssh:default_algorithms(),
 1872: 
 1873:             %% Start ssh on the slave. This should apply the ConfFile:
 1874:             ok = rpc:call(Node, ssh, start, []),
 1875:             R1 = rpc:call(Node, ssh, default_algorithms, []),
 1876:             ct:log("R1 = ~p",[R1]),
 1877:             [{kex,[K1]} | _] = R1,
 1878: 
 1879:             %% Start a daemon
 1880:             {Server, Host, Port} = rpc:call(Node, ssh_test_lib, std_daemon, [Config, []]),
 1881:             {ok,ServerInfo} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, daemon_info, [Server]),
 1882:             ct:log("ServerInfo =~n~p", [ServerInfo]),
 1883: 
 1884:             %% Test that the server_options env key works:
 1885:             [K2] = proplists:get_value(kex,
 1886:                    proplists:get_value(preferred_algorithms,
 1887:                    proplists:get_value(options, ServerInfo))),
 1888:             
 1889:             {badrpc, {'EXIT', {{badmatch,ExpectedError}, _}}} =
 1890:                 %% No common kex algorithms expected. 
 1891:                 rpc:call(Node, ssh_test_lib, std_connect, [Config, Host, Port, []]), 
 1892:             {error,"Key exchange failed"} = ExpectedError,
 1893: 
 1894:             C = rpc:call(Node, ssh_test_lib, std_connect,
 1895:                          [Config, Host, Port, 
 1896:                           [{modify_algorithms,[{append,[{kex,[K2]}]}]}]]),
 1897:             ConnInfo = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C]),
 1898:             ct:log("ConnInfo =~n~p", [ConnInfo]),
 1899:             Algs = proplists:get_value(algorithms, ConnInfo),
 1900:             ct:log("Algs =~n~p", [Algs]),
 1901:             ConnOptions = proplists:get_value(options, ConnInfo),
 1902:             ConnPrefAlgs = proplists:get_value(preferred_algorithms, ConnOptions),
 1903: 
 1904:             %% And now, are all levels applied in right order:
 1905:             [K3,K2] = proplists:get_value(kex, ConnPrefAlgs),
 1906: 
 1907:             peer:stop(Peer)
 1908:     end.
 1909: 
 1910:     
 1911: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1912: daemon_replace_options_simple(Config) ->
 1913:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1914: 
 1915:     UserDir1 = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1916:     UserDir2 = filename:join(UserDir1, "foo"),
 1917:     file:make_dir(UserDir2),
 1918: 
 1919:     {Pid, _Host, _Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1920:                                                {user_dir, UserDir1}
 1921:                                               ]),
 1922:     {ok,Opts1} = ssh:daemon_info(Pid),
 1923:     UserDir1 = proplists:get_value(user_dir, proplists:get_value(options,Opts1,[])),
 1924: 
 1925:     {ok, Pid} = ssh:daemon_replace_options(Pid, [{user_dir,UserDir2}]),
 1926:     {ok,Opts2} = ssh:daemon_info(Pid),
 1927:     case proplists:get_value(user_dir, proplists:get_value(options,Opts2,[])) of
 1928:         UserDir2 ->
 1929:             ok;
 1930:         UserDir1 ->
 1931:             ct:log("~p:~p Got old value ~p~nExpected ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,UserDir1,UserDir2]),
 1932:             {fail, "Not changed"};
 1933:         Other ->
 1934:             ct:log("~p:~p Got ~p~nExpected ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other,UserDir2]),
 1935:             {fail, "Strange value"}
 1936:     end.
 1937: 
 1938: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1939: daemon_replace_options_algs(Config) ->
 1940:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1941:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1942: 
 1943:     DefaultKex =
 1944:         ssh_transport:default_algorithms(kex),
 1945:     NonDefaultKex =
 1946:         ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(kex) -- DefaultKex,
 1947: 
 1948:     case NonDefaultKex of
 1949:         [A1|_] ->
 1950:             [A2,A3|_] = DefaultKex,
 1951:             {Pid, _Host, _Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1952:                                                        {user_dir, UserDir},
 1953:                                                        {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 1954:                                                       ]),
 1955:             [A1] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex),
 1956:             {ok, Pid} =
 1957:                 ssh:daemon_replace_options(Pid, [{modify_algorithms,
 1958:                                                   [{prepend,[{kex,[A2]}]}]
 1959:                                                  }
 1960:                                                 ]),
 1961:             [A2,A1] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex),
 1962: 
 1963:             {ok, Pid} =
 1964:                 ssh:daemon_replace_options(Pid, [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A3]}]
 1965:                                                  }
 1966:                                                 ]),
 1967:             [A2,A3] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex)
 1968:             ;
 1969:         [] ->
 1970:             {skip, "No non-default kex"}
 1971:     end.
 1972: 
 1973: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1974: daemon_replace_options_algs_connect(Config) ->
 1975:     [A1,A2|_] =
 1976:         ssh_transport:default_algorithms(kex),
 1977: 
 1978:     {Pid, Host, Port} =
 1979:         ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config,
 1980:                                 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 1981:                                 ]),
 1982:     [A1] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex),
 1983: 
 1984:     %% Open a connection with A1 as kex and test it
 1985:     C1 =
 1986:         ssh_test_lib:std_connect(Config, Host, Port,
 1987:                                  [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 1988:                                  ]),
 1989:     ok = test_connection(C1),
 1990:     ok = test_not_connect(Config, Host, Port,
 1991:                           [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A2]}]}
 1992:                           ]),
 1993: 
 1994:     %% Change kex to A2
 1995:     {ok, Pid} =
 1996:         ssh:daemon_replace_options(Pid,
 1997:                                    [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A2]}]}]),
 1998:     [A2] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex),
 1999: 
 2000:     %% and open the second connection with this kex, and test it
 2001:     C2 =
 2002:         ssh_test_lib:std_connect(Config, Host, Port,
 2003:                                  [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A2]}]}
 2004:                                  ]),
 2005:     ok = test_connection(C2),
 2006:     ok = test_not_connect(Config, Host, Port,
 2007:                           [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 2008:                           ]),
 2009: 
 2010:     %% Test that the first connection is still alive:
 2011:     ok = test_connection(C1),
 2012: 
 2013:     ssh:close(C1),
 2014:     ssh:close(C2),
 2015:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 2016: 
 2017: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2018: daemon_replace_options_algs_conf_file(Config) ->
 2019:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2020:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 2021: 
 2022:     DefaultKex =
 2023:         ssh_transport:default_algorithms(kex),
 2024:     NonDefaultKex =
 2025:         ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(kex) -- DefaultKex,
 2026: 
 2027:     case NonDefaultKex of
 2028:         [A0,A1|_] ->
 2029:             %% Make config file:
 2030:             {ok,ConfFile} =
 2031:                 make_config_file_in_privdir(
 2032:                   "c4.config", Config,
 2033:                   [{ssh, [{modify_algorithms,
 2034:                            %% Whatever happens, always put A0 first in the kex list:
 2035:                            [{prepend, [{kex, [A0]}]}
 2036:                            ]}
 2037:                          ]}
 2038:                   ]),
 2039: 
 2040:             [A2|_] = DefaultKex,
 2041:             ct:log("[A0, A1, A2] = ~p", [[A0, A1, A2]]),
 2042: 
 2043:             %% Start the slave node with the configuration just made:
 2044:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-config", ConfFile]),
 2045: 
 2046:             %% Start ssh on the slave. This should apply the ConfFile:
 2047:             rpc:call(Node, ssh, start, []),
 2048: 
 2049:             {Pid, _Host, _Port} =
 2050:                 rpc:call(Node, ssh_test_lib, daemon,
 2051:                          [
 2052:                           [{system_dir, SysDir},
 2053:                            {user_dir, UserDir},
 2054:                            {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 2055:                           ]
 2056:                          ]),
 2057: 
 2058:             [A0,A1] =
 2059:                 rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, get_preferred_algorithms, [Pid, kex]),
 2060:             {ok, Pid} =
 2061:                 rpc:call(Node, ssh, daemon_replace_options,
 2062:                          [Pid,
 2063:                           [{modify_algorithms,
 2064:                             [{prepend,[{kex,[A2]}]}]
 2065:                            }
 2066:                           ]
 2067:                          ]),
 2068: 
 2069:             %% Check that the precedens order is fulfilled:
 2070:             [A2,A0,A1] =
 2071:                 rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, get_preferred_algorithms, [Pid, kex]),
 2072: 
 2073:             peer:stop(Peer);
 2074:         [] ->
 2075:             {skip, "No non-default kex"}
 2076:     end.
 2077: 
 2078: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2079: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 2080: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2081: 
 2082: expected_ssh_vsn(Str) ->
 2083:     try
 2084: 	{ok,L} = application:get_all_key(ssh),
 2085: 	proplists:get_value(vsn,L,"")++"\r\n"
 2086:     of
 2087: 	Str -> true;
 2088: 	"\r\n" -> true;
 2089: 	_ -> false
 2090:     catch
 2091: 	_:_ -> true %% ssh not started so we don't know
 2092:     end.
 2093: 	    
 2094: 
 2095: fake_daemon(_Config) ->
 2096:     Parent = self(),
 2097:     %% start the server
 2098:     Server = spawn(fun() ->
 2099: 			   {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0,[{packet,line}]),
 2100: 			   {ok,{Host,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
 2101: 			   ct:log("fake_daemon listening on ~p:~p~n",[Host,Port]),
 2102: 			   Parent ! {sockname,self(),Host,Port},
 2103: 			   Rsa = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 2104: 			   ct:log("Server gen_tcp:accept got ~p",[Rsa]),
 2105: 			   {ok,S} = Rsa,
 2106: 			   receive
 2107: 			       {tcp, S, Id} -> Parent ! {id,self(),Id}
 2108: 			   after 
 2109: 			       10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2110: 			   end
 2111: 		   end),
 2112:     %% Get listening host and port
 2113:     receive
 2114: 	{sockname,Server,ServerHost,ServerPort} -> {Server, ServerHost, ServerPort}
 2115:     after 
 2116: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2117:     end.
 2118: 
 2119: 
 2120: make_config_file_in_privdir(FileName, Config, Contents) ->
 2121:     %% write the file:
 2122:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2123:     ConfFile = filename:join(PrivDir, FileName),
 2124:     {ok,D} = file:open(ConfFile, [write]),
 2125:     io:format(D, "~p.~n", [Contents]),
 2126:     file:close(D),
 2127:     {ok,Cnfs} = file:read_file(ConfFile),
 2128:     ct:log("Config file ~p :~n~s", [ConfFile,Cnfs]),
 2129:     {ok,ConfFile}.
 2130: 
 2131: 
 2132: get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, Type) ->
 2133:     {ok,#{preferred_algorithms:=As}} = ssh_system_sup:get_acceptor_options(Pid),
 2134:     proplists:get_value(Type, As).
 2135: 
 2136: test_connection(C) ->
 2137:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 2138:     A = rand:uniform(100),
 2139:     B = rand:uniform(100),
 2140:     A_plus_B = lists:concat([A,"+",B,"."]),
 2141:     Sum = integer_to_binary(A+B),
 2142:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, A_plus_B, infinity),
 2143:     expected = ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result(
 2144:                  {ssh_cm, C, {data, Ch, 0, Sum}} ),
 2145:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_end(C, Ch),
 2146:     ok.
 2147: 
 2148: test_not_connect(Config, Host, Port, Opts) ->
 2149:     try
 2150:         ssh_test_lib:std_connect(Config, Host, Port, Opts)
 2151:     of
 2152:         Cx when is_pid(Cx) -> {error, connected}
 2153:     catch
 2154:         error:{badmatch, {error,_}} -> ok
 2155:     end.
 2156:
